definition: to follow your orders/to do as you bid
to observe/to obey/to follow/to comply with
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc

sentences.chinese: 苏带着疲倦，遵命拉起窗帘。

sentences.english: Hermes immediately obeyed and glided down from the heavens to the earth.
sentences.chinese: 赫密斯立刻遵命，从天上飞到地面上。

sentences.english: The usher took the paper, cast a glance upon it, and obeyed.
sentences.chinese: 执达吏接了那张纸，瞟了一眼，便遵命照办了。

sentences.english: Some of those charged with enforcing the blockade have come to regret their participation.
sentences.chinese: 一些当时遵命执行封锁的军人已开始痛悔当时的参与。

sentences.english: Anyway, lord and master, I'll do as you say.
sentences.chinese: 反止，我的主子老爷，我一定遵命就是。

definition: to promise/to agree to do sth
to obey the Emperor's decree/at your Imperial majesty's command
to petition for retirement (old)/to ask for leave to withdraw/to ask to be excused
to retire/to withdraw/to retreat/to step down
